summary: “Regulatory capture” is when regulators act in the interest of the industry they’re regulating, rather than in service of the public good. This can be a significant problem in banking regulation, where regulators may be swayed by future job offerings and more. We looked at ways to reduce the risk of regulatory capture at the Office of the Comptroller of the Currency—which supervises the nation's...
title: Large Bank Supervision: OCC Could Better Address Risk of Regulatory Capture
